headline: Ukraine’s Leader Learns Going After Corruption Was a Lot Easier on TV
abstract: For Volodymyr Zelensky, taking on the oligarchs and organized crime is a domestic test with geopolitical consequences.
lead_paragraph: KYIV, Ukraine — Kateryna Rozhkova, the first deputy governor of Ukraine’s central bank, had just about learned to live with the hundreds of protesters banging metal rods and drums outside her office when they started gathering every morning outside her house.
keywords: Trump-Ukraine Whistle-blower Complaint and Impeachment Inquiry
